ok. What happens if you run  apt-cache search build-essential
already resolved it, i hadn't updated my repos
there is apt-file search (have to install apt-file package) and dpkg -S /path/to/file is similar to rpm -qf /path/to/file
this is to show where an existing file comes from?
dpkg -S is to show for existing file, apt-file will show you any file matching the searchstring (in the packages available in repository, similar to yum whatprovides)
use -F to prevent that  apt-file search -F /bin/cp
